text: Draft an Zlý Časy Prague quite unussual taste for matuka with not that hitting aroma like with most of the other beers. But like everytime perfectly ballanced and though high rating.

Bottled. Very good, although a bit strong beer, but with extraordinary taste and lovely aroma. Very clear light amber color with lovely white foam, Medium body, rather sweet and grassy, properly malted with a fine finish.

Draught
Aroma-herbs, fruits
Appearance-pale, clear, white foam, 
Taste-medium bitterness, light sweetness, 
Palate-medium body, sticky, average carbonation, bitter finish
Overall-very good

(tap 0,5l @ OP(Brno))
Noble hops, clean malty, helles like aroma. Clear golden color. Huge white head. Medium sweet, medium bitter, light hoppy taste. Full body. Long bitter finish. Something between helles, pilsner, heller bock and imperial pilsner.
Bottle @ Rasmuss. Pours yellow with a white head. Aroma of malt, grain, fruit, grassy hops. Flavor is malt, grainy, fruity, grassy hops. Medium body, lively carbonation. 260913
Bottle, 6.5%. Slightly hazy yellow with medium white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, cereal and hop. Flavour is malt, fruit, cereal, medium sweet, grass and a little bitter.
Bottle @ Aarhus tasting. Hazy yellow with a lasting white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, grainy and light fruity. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish 260913
Bottle. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are malt, grass, fruits and hops. A little too high carbonation.

Draft.  Clear light amber body with medium off-white head.  Aroma is medium sweet, cereal, some orange, light honey.  Taste is moderately sweet, bread, orange, some cereal, light spicy, honey.  Soft medium body.
Tap at Starosloviensky pivovar, Bratislava. Golden color with huge white head. Malty aroma. Malty, grainy taste with citrous hops. Bittersweet. finish. Good.

Yellow color with 1 finger head. Aroma of  hey, malts, a bit citrus. Taste is light sweet, light sour and light  bitter, refreshing. Light body, oslick texture, avarage carbonation. Nice and refreshing
On tap at Klub malych Pivovaru in Pilsen.Pours pale golden with a puffy white head.Grassy,hoppy,grainy with notes of soy sauce,rotten egg,menthol,citrus and lemon seeds..

Bottle from Pivotéka u Modrého lva. Clear golden colour, huge white airy head, fully lasting.  The aroma is mostly malty, grain and caramel. Also some hops, mix of floral and citrus, distinguishable Saaz. The taste is medium to light heavy sweet, almost medium bitter. Also quite a lot of sediment floating around. Fizzy carbonation makes for some belching. The higher ABV is clearly noticeable though not unpleasant, good drinkability. The finish is light sweet, light bitter, hoppy. Definitely a good beer.

0.75l bottle from Pivni Rozmanitosts stall at Pragues Easter market on Namesti republiky. Slightly hazy golden colour, big white head. Grainy malt falvours with lovely lemony hop flavours, also slightly resiny. Quite hoppy for the style - a very pleasant experience.

Bottle. Golden with a big and frothy head. Aroma is strongly bready malty, very hoppy for this style, with citrus, oranges and cammomille. Now, that is interesting! The taste is less sweet than expected, there is some alcoholic astringency but it blends in nicely with the strong bitterness, and both are balanced by the full malty body. Herbal and citrusy aftertaste. I had some cross-stylistic thoughts, as the taste profile (alcoholic + bitter vs. sweet) reminded me somewhat of a slightly less bitter Imperial IPA, while the orangey aroma of a Tripel. Either way, Adam Matuska has managed the unthinkable - a light bock beer that I enjoyed very much!

earthy, rotten eggs, soy sauce, citrus, grass, bread, caramel, golden, sparkling, white foam, rocky head, light sweetness, very bitter, medium sourness, umami, medium body, sticky, average carbonation, bitter, long finish,

on tap, sampled at both kulovy blesk and klub malych pivovaru. very pale golden with a steady head; aroma of white grape seed, canola; full-bodied with plenty of grassy bitterness and a herbaceous finish of nettles and menthol. more quality stuff from this brewery that seems incapable of putting a foot wrong
Bottle. Nice bock, pretty color and smaller head, nice palate and pleasant taste.
